---------------------------------------------------
======================== MSP to MetFrag parameter ========================
----------- Description -----------
| Read spectra from MSP file and create MetFrag parameter file.
----------- Input files -----------
+------------------------------+------------+ | File | Format | +==============================+============+ | 1) MSP file(s) | MSP | +------------------------------+------------+
---------- Parameters ----------
Intensity threshold of largest peak | The threshold the largest peak must have to be recognized. |
Minimum proportion of peaks | All peaks less than a percentage value with regard to the largest peak are rejected. |
Neutral losses of precursor to fragments | Add neutral losses of precursor to fragments of the spectrum. |
Neutral losses of fragments to fragments | Add neutral losses among fragments to fragments of the spectrum. |
Polarity | The polarity used for the mode of acquisition. |
Precursor ion type | The ion type of the precursor. |
Database Search Relative Mass Deviation | A value in ppm that defines the deviation of theoretical masses in the database vs. the measured masses. |
Fragment Peak Match Absolute Mass Deviation | Absolute mass deviation in Dalton of theoretical fragment peaks vs. measured fragment peaks. |
Fragment Peak Match Relative Mass Deviation | Relative mass deviation in ppm of theoretical fragment peaks vs. measured fragment peaks. |
Suspect list | Choose whether to include a file containing a list of suspects. |
MetFrag Score Types | The type of scores MetFrac is using for the calculations. Please do not change the values unless you know what you are doing! |
MetFrag Score Weights | The weights of the different score types, separated with a comma and without whitespaces. 1.0 means 100%. |
MetFrag Database Type | Database to choose from. |
------------ Output files ------------
+------------------------------------------+--------+ | Files | Format | +==========================================+========+ | 1) (Multiple) MetFrag parameter list(s) | TXT | +------------------------------------------+--------+
